title: Developmental-stage specific single-cell human embryo dissociation
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Zona pellucida removal (for cleaved embryos, morula, early blastocyst stages (B1/B2 according to Gardner’s classification)
Timing: 5–15 min
The goal is to retrieve the embryo from the zona pellucida.
This step is only performed if processing cleavage stage, morula stage and early blastocyst stage embryos (B1/B2). The operator performs brief laser impulses (around 9) to open the zona pellucida.
In the GPGD/HSA droplet hold and immobilize the embryo with the holding micropipet.
Use the laser to perform the hole, shoot the zona pellucida as far as possible of cells to open a hole large as 1.5× the biopsy micropipet (with a ZILOS-tk Hamilton-Thorne we use a laser power at 100% for 300 μs). A hole is visible in the zona pellucida (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A and Methods video S1[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc1]: Zona pellucida removal for cleaved embryos).

Mural / polar laser dissection
Timing: 5–15 min

This step is specifically for expanded blastocysts (B3/B4 according to Gardner’s classification3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3]). At this stage, dissociating polar vs. mural is critical, either to focus the analysis on the polar side, that contains the 3 main cell types of interest: epiblast (EPI), primitive endoderm (PrE) and trophectoderm (TE), or to capture differential-maturation events between mural and polar TE.
The operator starts by performing brief laser impulses to separate the polar TE and Inner cell mass (ICM) from the mural TE of the blastocyst (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B and Methods video S2[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc2]: Mural / polar laser dissection).
In the droplet, with the help of micropipettes, rotate the embryo in order to have the polar side close to the holding micropipet.
Hold and immobilize the blastocyst to strongly maintain the polar side in front of the holding micropipet.
Place the biopsy micropipet as close as possible to the mural trophectoderm, at the complete opposite side and apply a gentle suction pressure.
Use the laser to perform the dissection.
Shoot the zona pellucida and the trophectoderm as close as possible to the ICM, in each visible cell junction from one side to the other (up and down on the screen, 3 times, with a ZILOS-tk Hamilton-Thorne we use a laser power at 100% for 700 μs).
Simultaneously separate the 2 parts progressively by pulling each micropipet apart.
Use the laser until the 2 parts (mural and polar) are fully separated.
Critical: Aspiration / holding setup should be equilibrated. Embryo should be placed at the bottom of the dish to ensure stability and homogeneous laser power.

Single cell dissociation at cleavage stage and morula stage
Timing: 5–20 min

Once extruded or aspirated through the zona pellucida hole, cells should be gently pipetted in and out with 135 μm tips in G-PGD/HAS solution at 37°C to be individualized (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C and Methods video S3[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc3] Single cell dissociation at morula stage).
Perform the cell dissociation:
Triturate with gentle pipette flush under stereo microscope. G-PGD-HAS solution allows very easy dissociation of the cells.
Single cell can be isolated by aspiration and flushing.
Note: It is important to respect tips size to avoid breaking cell membrane.
Washing may be necessary depend on the analysis performed. Three washing steps in individual droplets of appropriate medium (often PBS) is recommended.
Replace cell isolated in the adapted container for your analysis.

Single cell dissociation at B1/B2 stage, B3/B4 or B5/B6 hatched blastocysts
Timing: 15–60 min
Embryos or embryo sections were incubated in G-PGD/HSA and transferred in Accutase. Embryos were gently pipetted in and out under stereo microscope. Single-cells/clumps were washed in GTL and gently pipetted in and out again if necessary. Single-cells were picked one by one upon dissociation (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D).
The mural or polar section, or the entire blastocyst, is incubated in the GPGD droplet for 10 min at 37°C with a 170 μm tips.
Note: Repeated aspirations and flush helps homogeneous diffusion of the media.
Place the section or the entire blastocyst in the accutase droplet for 3–4 min at room temperature with a 135 μm tips.
Pipet in and out around thirty to fifty times the cell cluster in the droplet with gentle pipette flush under stereo microscope.

During pipetting, to avoid, bubbles formation or cell lost, use the three droplets.
Single cell can be picked as soon as they individualize (Methods video S4[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc4] Isolation of single cells after accutase treatment of blastocysts).
Place the single cell or the clumps in the first GTL droplet at room temperature with a 75 μm tips.
Triturate with gentle pipette flush under stereo microscope.
Single cell can be isolated by aspiration and flushing.
Washing may be necessary depend on the analysis performed. Three washing steps in individual droplets of appropriate medium (often PBS) is recommended
Replace cell isolated in the container adapted for your downstream analysis.
Critical: Steps 1 to 6 are performed at 37°C; steps 7 to 8 - with accutase - were performed at room temperature.
